isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT - 1992 - 1993 - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ENGINE BRAKE SYSTEM

svcprocinfo.para: The ECM shares control of the Engine Brake System with the vehicle driver and the Antilock Brake System (ABS) if the vehicle is so equipped. The operator turns ON the engine brake ON/OFF switch and selects two-, four- or six-cylinder braking.

If the vehicle is equipped with ABS, the 12-volt power supply to the Engine Brake ON/OFF is from the ABS Engine Brake relay. This allows the ABS system to turn OFF the engine brake when wheel slip is detected.
The ECM will not energize the engine brake enable relay if it senses any of the following conditions:

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake On/Off Switch (170)
svcsubproc.para: The engine brake on/off switch is a 2-pole, single throw switch. One pole (with switch closed) sends 12V ignition power from fuse F2 to the engine brake enable relay (175) at the normally open terminal.
The other pole (with switch closed) sends a 5 volt signal to the ECM at terminal #5. This signal tells the ECM that the engine brake switch is in the ON position.

svcsubproc.title: ENGINE BRAKE ENABLE RELAY (175)
svcsubproc.para: The engine brake enable relay must be energized by voltage from the ECM for the engine brake to operate. A 12V signal from the ECM 9-way connector (312) on circuit 24AA activates the engine brake enable relay control coil which is grounded at the right cowl inner panel. The ECM enables the engine brake system using the relay, if all previously discussed conditions are judged to be correct.

svcsubproc.title: ENGINE BRAKE SELECTOR SWITCH (171)
svcsubproc.para: The engine brake selector switch sends the 12 volt ignition power through the ECM 9-way connector to selected engine brake solenoids. The power does not go through the ECM.

svcsubproc.title: SERVICE BRAKE SWITCH (69)
svcsubproc.para: The brake switch (normally closed) serves both the cruise control and engine brake system. When the brakes are not applied, a 5V signal is applied to ECM terminal #13. The normally closed service brake switch opens when the brakes are applied and the 5V is not applied to ECM terminal #13.

svcsubproc.title: CLUTCH SWITCH
svcsubproc.para: The clutch switch serves both the cruise and engine brake system. The switch is a normally open switch, adjusted to be closed when the clutch pedal is in the released position. With the clutch released, a 5V signal is applied through the clutch switch to ECM terminal #4.
